p: The use of animals in essential research has been constantly questioned in terms of the principles of the 3Râ€™s (replacement, reduction and refinement), thus creating the need for reflection in the number of animals used in research (reduction), the possibility of replacing vertebrate animals with invertebrates, embryos, microorganisms, organs or isolated tissues, in addition to guaranteeing the quality of experiments (refinement), where this principle underscores training for the correct use of animal handling techniques, aseptic techniques in surgical procedures, correct dose administrations and other recommendations for carrying out high quality experiments [ 1].
